dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Habitat and Ecology
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: De Grave, S. & Klotz, W. 2013. Caridina serrata. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
The species inhabits very small streams at higher altitude, in undisturbed secondary forest and scrubland. The species has abbreviated larval development and does not migrate to the sea for reproduction (Yam and Dudgeon 2005).

Systems
  • Freshwater

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: De Grave, S. & Klotz, W. 2013. Caridina serrata. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
NT
Near Threatened

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
De Grave, S. & Klotz, W.

Reviewer/s
Cumberlidge, N. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species is only known from two streams on Hong Kong Island and three streams on Lantau Island (Hong Kong) (Cai and Ng 1999, Yam and Dudgeon 2005, W. Klotz, pers com. 2012). The streams from which the species is known are all within Country Parks, affording some protection to the species from encroaching urbanization. It is however acknowledged that the species inhabits a very small area (EOO far less than 100 km2) and given that its entire known distribution is within a major urban conglomeration, the species is considered to be Near Threatened (close to meeting VU D2).

dataObjects.title: Population
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: De Grave, S. & Klotz, W. 2013. Caridina serrata. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Population
During 2000-2002, the species was considered to be abundant, with 45-68 individuals per m2 (Yam and Dudgeon 2005).

Population Trend
Unknown

No threats to the species could be identified.
